intro: Wikstroemia amplifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf sandarac, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used in various traditional applications. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
